solution_line_template: The total number of days in {num_weeks} weeks is {num_weeks} * {days_per_week} = <<{num_weeks}*{days_per_week}={total_days}>>{total_days} days.

If {koi_added_per_day} koi fish are added every day, the total after {total_days} days is {total_days} * {koi_added_per_day} = <<{total_days}*{koi_added_per_day}={total_koi_added}>>{total_koi_added} koi fish.

if {goldfish_added_per_day} goldfish are added every day, the total after {total_days} days is {goldfish_added_per_day} * {total_days} = <<{goldfish_added_per_day}*{total_days}={total_goldfish_added}>>{total_goldfish_added} goldfish.

The total number of fish in the tank after {num_weeks} weeks is {initial_total_fish} + {total_koi_added} + {total_goldfish_added} = <<{initial_total_fish}+{total_koi_added}+{total_goldfish_added}={final_total_fish}>>{final_total_fish} fish.
If there were a total of {final_goldfish} goldfish in the tank after {num_weeks} weeks, then the number of koi in the tank is {final_total_fish} - {final_goldfish} = {final_koi_fish} koi fish.
